reviews.sentence: Top notch service. With a family of six that was juggling a travel schedule the front desk and concierge were all about service. Great thanks to them. Room and facilities were top notch as I have come to expect with embassy suites. Great service convenience shuttle to airport. Just off the airport lots of chain restaurants near by. Wait staff at the bar in the early evening was a bit overwhelmed and seemed short handed.

great location regarding the airport. Very God 45 good breakfast room etc. We recommend Embassy Suites as we have stayed in them before. Love the style of the rooms atrium etc. Location cleanliness style breakfast. great location for the airport nothing.

In need of an Upgrade. You know that feeling of anticipation because your company booked you in a nice hotel. I had that feeling until I walked into my room. Old furnishings and worn carpets. Now the room and the lobby was very clean just tired.

FAMILY GETAWAY. I LOVED this hotel and it is location. The staff was exceptionally friendly polite helpful and the facility is very well kept. The breakfast was very good. Close to everything. Best bang for your buck Really does not get better than this. My family and I will return soon. Staff and location Traveled to Universal Studios and visited with family. Live entertainment might be nice.

Orlando 2015. We enjoy our stay and would stay again next time in Orlando. The staff were all very nice. All areas of the hotel are well kept and clean. The 530 to 730 free drinks at the lobby bar were a nice treat each day.

Nice hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I love the suite style of Embassy along with the free breakfast and evening reception. Rooms were very clean and the hotel was in proximity to just about everything.

Comfortable hotel with nice amenities. Friendly staff free shuttle service from Orlando International Airport to the hotel less than 10 minute drive and our driver was great. included breakfast buffet full breakfast not a continental breakfastWe had to call the hotel and wait to get picked up which was a little confusing. A little pricey for what we needed but the room was clean spacious and comfortable.

Beaware of a 10 per night car parking fee. This Embassy Suites Hotel is an older facility but has been kept up well. It was very clean. Service was excellent. The only complaint I have was the hotel tried to charge me 100 per night to park my rental car. I was never told I would be charged for parking. There is no mention of a charge for parking in any marketing materials. There was no gate to monitor your cars coming and going. When I confronted the desk clerk she was willing to remove the 10 per night charge. She said they have been charging the 10 per night for parking since Feb 2015. You need to check your statement before checkout and ask they remove the charge for parking.

Great Location Friendly Helpful Staff. We have stayed here at least 25 times and it would be even more times but its so convenient to the airport that sometimes the supply and demand makes the rate prohibitive for our budget. The area has a variety of good restaurants nearby. Morning Breakfast is excellent and it adds value as does the evening managers reception. We have been there several times on Holidays and they have left cards with candy in the room. Even got a Christmas Stocking one year. They have a great shuttle service if you are flying and its less than 10 minutes to the airport which makes it great if you have an early morning flight. It is also near the Florida Mall and affords easy access to all the major Orlando attractions. My one suggestion to the hotel is to fix the ice machine on the second floor. The temporarily out of service sign has been there on our last 3 stays.

Happy visitors. The accommodations were excellent along with staff. Very friendly and helpful. Cocktail reception and cook to order breakfast fantastic. Extremely clean hotel can not say enough good things about our stay. Highly recommend.

Mixed Bag. There was no one at the Hhonors Check in area always a pet peeve but when we were able to speak to the clerk we were allowed to check in just before 10 AM after a pair of flights totaling over 12 hours from Hawaii. Albeit in different room types than we had reserved NOT an issue. I certainly did not however get a warm fuzzy from any of the front desk staff. The room was fine if a bit awkward a sink in the bathroom and another in the bedroom with very little counter space for toiletries. There are NO accessible outlets near the bed this is the second decade of the 21st century and THAT is irritating. I had to pull back the nightstand to plug in my cell phone. The elevators were a whole other source of frustration they were incredibly slow and often the buttons did not light up or if they did light would extinguish. The breakfast was fine the parking ample and free and the hotel well kept. However the HUGE crane in the atrium was distracting and we had no notification of that pending work when making the reservations. On the whole I am not a fan of Orlando and while the conference we attended was a success and more importantly very near to this hotel I am not eager to return. If I needed to be there briefly this hotel would suffice.

Horrible do not be fooled. The food manager was terrific. She felt bad about the music complaints so she bought me dinner the next day. I was there for four days. The hotel hosted a party with such loud music that my room was shaking. I was in the room right above the banquet hall. During the loud music from the party the window in my room shook loose from the frame and slipped down leaving it crooked and hot air rushing in. The engineer came to fix it by using tape duct to block the edge of the frame and keep the air out. I had to be up at 6 am and the party did not end until after 11. The Manager offered me points to stay another night but the next day when I needed to book a room because the conference committee I was on decided to do an extra day suddenly the points I was given for a free stay was not valid and they were going to charge me double for one more night. On top of that the elevator was broken and the room was so musty I had to buy air freshener at Walgrens to stomach the smell of stale cigarettes and mildew. This is the worst hotel I could have ever stayed in during my conference. Awful.

Horrible staff. nice place but the staff treated me horrible. I did not like how I was treated because I booked through a third party. the staff treated me as though I tried to get away with something by going through a third party for booking. I have done this many time in the past and it was never an issue. i was denied my points for honors and denied access to facilities. I travel a lot but I will not be staying at another facility in this group of hotels. if you do not want to sell your rooms through a third party then do not sell a third party blocks of rooms. you lost a customer and I will be telling all of my business associates about this.

Good. The renovated room was very nice and comfortable. The front desk staff at check. in were very friendly and attentive. I arrived after dark and did not realize the entrance was on the side of the building. It would have been nice to have known there was renovation going on at the time of booking. The check out staff in the morning seemed very disinterested I was wearing an arm brace on my right hand and was struggling to fold the receipt. The desk clerk watched me and did not offer to assist until I was finished. He seemed to be pre occupied with talking to another staff member.

Room was next door to elevator in front pool righ in back. Pool hours go until 11 pm. My family was tired from traveling all day but loud kids kept us awake until pool closed. We tried to switch rooms but was told other rooms had other noise issues. Shuttle was a nice perk but a long wait with other tired people.

Room was not ready at 1730 check in. Waited an additional half hour to get the room. Room itself was clean and the living room cieling fan was quiet and effective. Sleeping room however did not have a fan and the room was very warm throughout the night even after placing the air on 68. Very uncomfortable for the kids and wife. Lobby area is undergoing renovations of the bathrooms. Closed off a lot of the initial walkway upon entering making it uncomfortable to get by or waiting to speak with the front desk. Carpeting in the hallways is dated and clashes with the beautiful tile in the front entrance. Perhaps this is another renovation step later. Interior glass elevators overlooking inside atrium of embassy suites is a design staple that is always enjoyable. But the elevators need a major overhaul. Floor buttons inside and call buttons outside seemed flimsy with the surrounding paneling easy to move when pressing. Floors in the elevators were just bad and looked like they were missing a layer. Parking is 16. They offer free parking for veterans but I still received a 16 parking fee even though I checked in while in uniform and after showing my ID. Did not notice the charge until traveling back home. I will need to call and that is time out of my day. I like normally enjoy staying at embassy suites but I would recommend waiting until renovations are complete for this one.

Nice place but elevators need work NOW. Nice hotel close to eating and shopping areas. Comfortable rooms but only one elevator was operational and it was extremely slow. Guests ended up waiting for the elevator for quite a while every time they needed to go to their rooms or back to the lobby.

Good. I like the breakfast. What I did not like on this trip. It was our 23th anniversary After checking in. we got our keys they did not work. I had to use the bathroom very bad one 1 elevator was working. It took over 25 mins to get in the room UNACEPATABLE. Twice they gave us the wrong key. Then later that evening both elevators was down over 24 hours. We were on the forth floor. UNACEPATABLE. After shopping we had to wait in line to use the service elevator. UNACEPATABLE.

Good. Staff was great and accommodating. Great location. Elevator broken for the entire stay with little done to minimize wait time. There was a service elevator available but you no one directed you to it. We were just left to wait wait extended periods of time. We were even stuck in broken elevator at one point.

Good. Staff was great and accommodating. Great location. Elevator broken for the entire stay with little done to minimize wait time. There was a service elevator available but you no one directed you to it. We were just left to wait wait extended periods of time. We were even stuck in broken elevator at one point.
